Submodules

oracle.architectures module

class oracle.architectures.GRU(taxonomy: Taxonomy, ts_feature_dim=5)

Bases: Hierarchical_classifier

forward(batch)

Define the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

get_latent_space_embeddings(batch)

Define the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

oracle.taxonomies module

class oracle.taxonomies.BTS_Taxonomy(**attr)

Bases: Taxonomy

class oracle.taxonomies.ORACLE_Taxonomy(**attr)

Bases: Taxonomy

class oracle.taxonomies.Taxonomy(directed=True, **attr)

Bases: DiGraph

Class to represent a taxonomy as a directed graph.

get_class_probabilities(conditional_probabilities)

Get the class probabilities from the conditional probabilities.

Parameters:

conditional_probabilities – 2D numpy array of conditional probabilities (n_samples, n_nodes).

Returns:

2D numpy array of class probabilities (n_samples, n_nodes).

Return type:

class_probabilities

get_conditional_probabilities(logits, epsilon=1e-10)

Get the conditional probabilities from the logits, after applying the softmax function to sets of sibling nodes.

Parameters:

  • logits – 2D torch tensor of logits (n_samples, n_nodes).

  • epsilon – small value to avoid numerical problems with floating point numbers.

Returns:

2D torch tensor of conditional probabilities (n_samples, n_nodes).

Return type:

conditional_probabilities

get_depths()

Get the depths of the nodes in the taxonomy, ordered by level order traversal.

Returns:

list of depths of the nodes in the taxonomy, ordered by level order traversal.

Return type:

depths

get_hierarchical_one_hot_encoding(labels)

Get the hierarchical one-hot encoding for the labels.

Parameters:

labels – list of labels to encode (n_samples).

Returns:

2D numpy array of hierarchical one-hot encodings (n_samples, n_nodes).

Return type:

all_encodings

get_leaf_nodes()

Get the leaf nodes in the taxonomy.

Returns:

list of leaf nodes in the taxonomy.

Return type:

leaf_nodes

get_level_order_traversal()

Get the level order traversal of the taxonomy.

Returns:

list of nodes in the taxonomy ordered by level order traversal.

Return type:

level_order_nodes

get_nodes_by_depth()

Get the nodes in the taxonomy grouped by their depth.

Returns:

dictionary where keys are depths and values are lists of nodes at that depth.

Return type:

nodes_by_depth

get_parent_nodes()

Get the parent nodes for each node in the taxonomy, ordered by level order traversal.

Returns:

list of parent nodes for each node in the taxonomy, ordered by level order traversal.

Return type:

parents

get_paths(labels)

Get the paths from the root to the labels.

Parameters:

labels – list of labels to compute paths for (n_samples). Each label should be a leaf node in the taxonomy.

Returns:

list of paths from the root to the labels.

Return type:

paths

get_sibling_masks()

Get the sibling masks for each node in the taxonomy, ordered by level order traversal.

Returns:

list of numpy arrays of sibling mask indices for the taxonomy.

Return type:

masks

plot_colored_taxonomy(probabilities)

Plot the taxonomy, colored by values in

plot_taxonomy()

Plot the taxonomy using networkx and matplotlib.

Returns:

None
